attributes.action: Give Outer London tenants the same 'Right to Buy' £100k maximum discount as Inner London tenants.
attributes.additional_details: Why are thousands and thousands of Outer London tenants who are eligible to ‘Right to Buy’ discounts being unfairly and inequitably discriminated against vis-à-vis Inner London eligible tenants. The argument goes that they are eligible to receive the higher maximum discount of £100k (£75k outside London) because their property prices are higher than elsewhere. This is true nationally but to differentiate Inner and Outer London eligible tenants is misguided and discriminatory. Why? First, although we live just a few miles outside the 32 London Boroughs, our prices have soared on the back of their price increases. This is not surprising as we are part of Greater (Outer) London. Furthermore, we are Londoners anyway as we have an 0208 phone number, receive London Weighting and live in Travel Zone 6 which is part of the main London Travel Zones. What’s worse, a recent RTB valuation placed our house price above some similar Inner London properties. Give the £100k discount to all Londoners.
